articles.title: Black U.S. hockey player who was target of racist taunt calls for suspension - CBC.ca
articles.description: Jalen Smereck, an American defenceman for HC Donbass in the Ukrainian Hockey League, says he is taking a leave of absence until HC Kremenchuk player Andrey Denyskin is "suspended and removed from the league."
articles.content:
A player who was the target of a racist taunt during a Ukrainian Hockey League game on the weekend says he won't play in the league again until the opponent who made the gesture is disciplined.

articles.title: US generals say they recommended leaving 2,500 troops in Afghanistan - NEWS.com.au
articles.description: Top US generals said Tuesday that they advised keeping American troops in Afghanistan to bolster the Afghan government and expressed concern that the Taliban has not severed ties with Al-Qaeda.
articles.content: Taliban forces swiftly took over the airport in Kabul after the US military pulled out of Afghanistan in late August, 2021Top US generals said Tuesday that they advised keeping American troops in Afg… [+612 chars]

articles.title: Study: Most Americans 'resigned' to COVID future - UpperMichigansSource.com
articles.description: According to a Kaiser Family Foundation survey published Tuesday, 79% of adults believe COVID will continue at a low level, like the flu, and we’ll have to live with it for the foreseeable future.
articles.content:
(CNN) Most Americans expect a future with COVID-19.
